3. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 4. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
5. Your ability to drive safely can be impaired by:
column6: drugs, even if they are over-the-counter.

column2: 6. This sign means drivers should:
column6: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column8: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column10: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.

column2: 7. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column2: 8. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you must:
column6: pull over to the right and stop.
column8: drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
column10: stop as quickly as you can.

column2: 9. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
10. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 11. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 12. While driving, it is important to slow down:
13. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 14. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
15. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column8: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
17. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column10: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
20. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 21. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column10: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 22. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.
column6: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.
